newsitem.title: CANADA: Canadian dollar closes steady, eye on Buba.
newsitem.headline: Canadian dollar closes steady, eye on Buba.

text.p: * Canada's dollar ended little changed at C$1.3741 (US$0.7277) from Tuesday's close of C$1.3735 (US$0.7281). * Trading slow due to lack of moving economic news and in anticipation of Thursday's rate-setting Bundesbank meeting. * If German central bank drops rates, the Bank of Canada may follow.
* Unit likely to trade in similar range overnight.
Analysts have said a disappointing showing in Canada's June retail trade, to be released on Thursday, may tip the scales in favor of a rate ease.
"Nobody wants to make a really big bet right now," Kalirai said.
Trading is seen at a narrow range of C$1.3730 to C$1.3760 overseas, he said.
On the crosses, the Canada dollar fell to 1.0784 marks from Tuesday's close of 1.0830 marks and slid to 78.89 yen from 78.83 yen.
